chunk_id: Care During Pregnancy and Childbirth Training Manual for CHO at AB-HWC__chunk_168
source: Care During Pregnancy and Childbirth Training Manual for CHO at AB-HWC
text:
or a few hours afterwards. A team of two or three women with experience 
in attending labour would be helpful.
 ∙ Recognising the signs of labour: Advice the woman to go to the health facility or inform the ASHA to 
contact you and ANM if the woman has any one of the following signs, which indicate the start of labour:
 - A bloody, sticky discharge from the vagina (‘show’)
 - Painful uterine contractions increasing in duration, frequency and intensity with the passage of time.
